description: Senior UI/UX Designer, Web Applications A little about us. Splunk is here to build a safer and more resilient digital world. We’re proud to say that we’re the key to enterprise resilience for more than 11,000 enterprise organizations that use our Unified Security and Observability Platform to keep their systems secure and reliable. We’re also proud of our award-winning culture and our regular appearance on those “Best Places to Work” lists. If you end up joining us, we’ll only ask one thing: bring your whole, authentic self, what we call your million data points. So bring your work experience, problem-solving skills and talent, of course, but also bring your joy, your passion and all the things that make you, you. Because when you feel free to be you, it makes it a lot easier for us to be us. Job Description: As a Senior UX/UI Designer, within the IT Engineering department, you'll be involved in the full life-cycle of design for a portfolio of internal custom applications used across a diverse line of business, such as sales, marketing, customer success, human resources, recruiting, and products, to run our $2B+ and growing business. You’ll partner with product managers and engineers to deliver great experiences, as well as compelling user interfaces to both external and internal users, enabling them through phenomenal user experiences. We’re looking for thinkers and innovators who are willing to challenge the status quo and are energized by developing creative solutions to complex problems. In addition, great oral communication and written documentation skills are valuable for this role in promoting ideas throughout the company. What you'll do: Yeah, I want to and can do that. Work closely with product managers and engineering teams, to deliver best-in-class user experiences and compelling visual designs for a diverse portfolio of internal and external applications Perform usability studies to challenge established thinking and discover new ways of solving problems Develop user workflow diagrams, storyboards, prototypes, and wireframes Develop compelling visual designs for products that excite end-users and create brand awareness Present designs and effectively communicate design rationale to diverse stakeholders Partner with teams to define product roadmaps and prioritize requirements for releases Create detailed design specifications and design standards for enterprise IT applications Drive design in accord with principles of user-centered design Ensure projects fulfill business requirements, goals, and delight end-users Requirements: I’ve already done that or have that! 7+ years of combined experience in user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design 5+ years of experience designing for single-page web applications 5+ year of experience designing for mobile applications Expertise in the capabilities of CSS and Javascript Experience working on cross-browser, multi-device applications. Expertise in data visualization and information architecture Expertise in using industry-standard design and prototyping tools, such as Sketch, Figma, Adobe CC Expertise creating prototypes to communicate design concepts to users and project partners Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal Experience in a fast-paced, iterative development environment Preferred knowledge and experience: These are a huge plus. Experience delivering in an Agile environment Experience directing creative across multiple designers a strong plus Education: Got it! BS or MS in Visual Design or equivalent experience required What We Offer You: If you’d like to join one of the fastest-growing and most exciting tech companies in Silicon Valley, contact us! Benefits are an important part of Splunk's Total Rewards package. This role is eligible for a competitive benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, and much more! Learn more about our comprehensive benefits and wellbeing offering here. We prioritize diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging to ensure our employees are supported to bring their best, most authentic selves to work where they can thrive. Please contact us to request accommodation. description: Above Lending is a next-generation financial services company. We provide simple and transparent products aimed at helping our clients achieve their personal finance goals. With competitive rates and personalized support, our mission is to simplify the lending process and help borrowers attain financial well-being. We are committed to making credit more affordable and accessible. About the Role Above Lending is looking for a UX/UI Designer who advocates for our customers utilizing research and interaction design skills to optimize applications and improve ease of use to create the best possible user experience. The Designer will utilize industry standards, competitor research, user testing, performance data, wireframes and prototypes to communicate and sell ideas. They work as part of the Product team making a positive impact on the way customers experience Above Lending. As a Designer at Above, you will see projects through their full life cycle from research to the post-release phase, including QA. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, partnering with Product and Engineering, and pitching to stakeholders along the way. You will leverage analytics tools and techniques to support decision-making and prioritization, and to measure success. You will maintain a library of usability templates, guidelines, best practices, research documentation, and raw data. The ideal candidate is passionate about learning, testing, executing, analyzing and optimizing our customer experience to grow and drive the business forward. We are looking for someone who’s eager to work in a close-knit, collaborative environment and at the same time can take real ownership of their own projects and responsibilities. You will: Create and maintain wireframe systems, user flows, prototypes, specifications, navigation maps and user research findings Partner and collaborate with designers, coders, copywriters, and product managers to develop compelling and creative solutions Collaborate with marketing and operations teams to create new HTML emails. Iterate upon existing email content. Devise customer-centric, effective UX solutions for web and mobile applications Collaborating with engineering and product teams to understand technical considerations and communicate them to non-technical stakeholders Experience with an iterative testing approach that requires a rapid design, build, and measurement cycle Flexibility and adaptability to rework your designs based on legal, product, marketing, engineering and other stakeholder feedback You have: Bachelor’s Degree in HCI, Computer Science, Design or related discipline 5+ years of experience practicing UX Design at a technology or e-commerce company Wire-framing and prototyping experience with tools like Adobe XD, Sketch, Figma, etc. Ability to prototype and strong understanding of HTML/CSS, JavaScript, modern front-end JavaScript frameworks Excellent analytical skills; solid understanding of experiment design, measurement, and analysis (i.e. A/B testing) and the ability to make recommendations supported by data A proactive self-starter who enjoys and thrives working in a fast-paced environment Ability to meet deadlines, manage multiple projects, and remain flexible as priorities change Strong organizational skills and attention to detail Creative thinker with excellent communication skills What we offer: Health, dental and vision insurance Competitive base pay Bonus opportunities Flexible personal time-off 401(K) match More importantly, our team spirit and culture are what really sets us apart as a company. We’re a world-class company that loves what we do…and we have fun doing it! Join our dynamic team and contribute to Above Lending’s success as we continue to provide innovative lending solutions to our customers. Under the California Consumer Privacy Act (“CCPA”), Above Lending is informing California residents who are our job applicants, contractors or prospective employees (together “job applicants”) about the categories of personal information we collect about you and the purposes for which we will use this information. This notice and our Privacy Policy contain important information relating to the CCPA and apply only to personal information that is subject to the CCPA. Please see our website for the full CCPA statement. *Above Lending is an equal opportunity Employer* Above Lending does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third-party recruiting agencies in response to job positions. No fee will be paid to their parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to Above Lending employees or the Above Lending Finance and HR teams. No placement fee will be paid to any third party unless such a request has been made by the Above Lending HR team.

description: Our Austin-based Product Design (UX/UI) team is looking for an Austin-based Principal Product Designer to join their team. This individual will be expected to work out of our Downtown Austin HQ. We are following a hybrid office/work from home model (three days per week in-office/two days work from home). Note: To be considered, you must provide a link to an online portfolio (please include password). Summary: As a Product Design leader, you will provide direction, and mentorship for a team of Product Designers for both consumer-facing products, as well as internal, enterprise products. As leader, you will help to cultivate creative culture, guide high-impact design work, and lead a team of talented multidisciplinary designers with a focus on broader operational results. The role is perfect for someone with a passion for human-centered design, deep empathy and who can motivate and inspire a collaborative group of UX thinkers. Responsibilities: Provides day-to-day guidance and leadership for UX/UI Design Team Members. Oversees the creation of team member's individual goals to align with department goals and defines success outcomes. Encourages innovation and curiosity. Leads by example by bringing ideas to the table and encouraging team discussions. Rewards enthusiasm for solving business and user challenges. Work closely with designers, researchers, product managers, developers, brand, and leadership to develop a shared understanding of the user experience within the team. Oversees the full range of UX/UI Design activity, including: Providing UX/UI analysis, design, and development services across new and ongoing initiatives, platforms, and delivery channels, Delivering creative concepts to bring the WFM brand to life across platforms, apps, web, and other channels, Developing / communicating app and site structure and user paths. Ensures ‘ideal’ projects are balanced against technical constraints, business objectives, and operational processes. Engages with designers, developers, and other stakeholders to ensure effective integration with and support of team initiatives and associated activity. Engages with users on a regular basis to ensure understanding of expectations, experience, issues, and concerns. Leads team efforts to evaluate consumer, demographic, and other data to understand design principles, applications, and results. Be an internal and external thought leader that manages and provides support to direct reports in design methodologies, extending the team’s influence on design strategy and solutions. Establish and own team goals, applying an understanding of potential challenges to provide effective support. Leads functional continuous process improvement by recommending enhancements and identifying new tools and technologies. Evangelize the strength of design-thinking and demonstrate how its application across workstreams provides common ground among teams through a shared vocabulary, production of tangible artifacts, and the building of a trust-based team culture. Mentors junior to mid-level designers within Whole Foods Market and outside in the larger design community. description: Position Summary: RT Specialty is seeking a UX/UI Designer to help execute user-friendly design for our digital products. The ideal candidate will be required to produce innovative solutions for our product designs making them practical yet straightforward to use. The UX/UI Designer will improve the efficiency of the product and help increase customer experience and satisfaction and profits of our company. This role will be multi-faceted and focus on: Hands-on experience with creating user-friendly and straightforward ideas for products. Learning how to organize, multitask and manage time to complete tasks. Hands on experience with wireframes, storyboards, and sitemaps. Learn on the job regarding the best practices in user interface and designing. Exposure to the design industry and its various responsibilities. Essential Functions: Use wireframes, storyboards, process flows and sitemaps to illustrate and present design ideas. Collaborate with product managers and engineers to understand the product before presenting solutions to improve the visual and interactive experience. Gather user requirements from product managers to create compelling and original graphic designs (images, sketches, etc). Build and design user interface elements like menus, tabs, widgets, page navigation buttons and search fields. Troubleshoot any UX problems. Present design concepts and ideas to colleagues, executive members, and clients. Ensure a standard is maintained when it comes to style, fonts, colors, and images. Conduct regular research on user experience. After collecting feedback ensure changes are made to correct any error. Stay up to date with all of the industry’s trends and best practices. Education/Experience/Skills: Bachelor's degree in Interaction Design, Computer Science or any other related field. Prior experience with UX/UI design with a strong portfolio to show previous work. Excellent knowledge of wireframing tools (Wireframe.cc, InVision, etc) Strong experience with creating wireframes, storyboards, user flow, process flow, and sitemaps. Excellent knowledge of visual design and wireframing tools like Photoshop, Illustrator, etc. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Great visual design, time management and multitasking skills. Good problem-solving ability with attention to detail. Well-read on the new technology and best practices in the market. Experience working on large-scale software projects within an agile environment A combination of relevant experience and education may be considered Disclaimer Ryan Specialty is an Equal Opportunity Employer

description: At Owens & Minor, we are a critical part of the healthcare process. As a Fortune 500 company with 50+ facilities across the US and 18,000 teammates in over 90 countries, we provide integrated technologies, products and services across the full continuum of care. Customers—and their patients—are at the heart of what we do. Our mission is to empower our customers to advance healthcare, and our success starts with our teammates. Owens & Minor teammate benefits include: Medical, dental, and vision insurance, available on first working day 401(k), eligibility after 30 days of employment Employee stock purchase plan Tuition reimbursement Development opportunities to grow your career with a global company $65 - $85K JOB SUMMARY As a key member of the Front-End Development team you will work on improving the Lofta client experience, create new products, and improve the performance of our website. Projects will include improving our current flagship Lofta.com as well as standing up and maintaining new sites focused on different health conditions. description: Are you passionate about creating delightful and seamless experiences? Do you get excited about your work having a real impact on kids, parents, and individuals who are serious about managing their finances and investing in their futures? If yes, then join us at Stockpile! Stockpile is a user-friendly investment app designed to empower families in building a secure financial future through collaborative, hands-on investing, and money management experiences. Our platform simplifies investing in stocks, making it accessible for both parents and children to learn and grow their wealth together. Children can learn by doing, making their own trades with adult approval, fostering financial literacy and independence. With a diverse selection of well-known stocks, Stockpile offers investment opportunities to suit families’ interests and goals. We are based in SF Bay Area and Los Angeles. We value face-to-face collaboration as well as performance. In this hybrid position, the right candidate will be primarily remote and, depending on location, attend in-person meetings in SF or LA and travel occasionally to meet with the rest of the team. What You Will Do Ownership: Own the end-to-end mobile app and web UX and designs. Design Artifacts: Create low and high-fidelity wireframes, clickable prototypes, journey maps, user flows, user personas, affinity maps, and other artifacts. Collaboration: Collaborate closely with product and engineering to translate business and user needs into a beautiful and delightful experience and manage the handoff to dev team. Prototyping: Employ design concepts and B2C best practices into functional prototypes. Journey Mapping: Create personas, journey maps, user flows, and site maps. Product Evolution: Work with the product team to iterate on product designs. Visual Language: Guide the creation of the product’s visual language and style guides. Design Critiques: Lead or participate in design critiques and give constructive feedback. Post-Launch: Continue to test the product post-launch and make decisions about necessary improvements or additions. About You With 5+ years of experience in B2C as the lead designer, you bring a wealth of expertise. Your background in B2C apps and payments or financial services products is invaluable. Agile methodology is second nature to you. Prior startup experience is a plus. You excel in design tools like Figma. Strong experience in ROI-driven A/B testing is a key part of your skill set. You thrive in a teamwork-oriented environment and remain productive even when UX stories aren't the top priority in every sprint. Your skill set includes UI/UX Design in HTML, CSS, JS and REACT. You have experience developing best practices, libraries, and style guides. Experience designing apps with 100K+ users. Experience using both qualitative and quantitative data points to make decisions. Flexibility with work hours in the Pacific Time zone. Maintain up-to-date knowledge of current industry trends and market conditions. Competitive salary depending on experience, education and location. You will receive health insurance with 85% of premiums covered for you and your dependents ensuring your well-being. Equity opportunities that align your success with the company's growth. Access to a 401K plan to help secure your financial future. The opportunity to collaborate with a dynamic team and do meaningful work! Submit your application now and experience the opportunity to collaborate with a dynamic team and do meaningful work!

description: Seattle, Washington, United States The Company: Placements.io is a product-first company that is changing the way digital media publishers manage their advertising businesses. The Position: We are seeking an experienced and creative UX/UI Designer to join our team. The UX/UI Designer will be responsible for designing and delivering high-quality user-centered designs for our platform, website, and marketing collateral. This role will involve a wide range of responsibilities, including but not limited to user research, wireframing, prototyping, visual design, and usability testing. Best of all, you’ll work with a small, smart, and driven team that’s not afraid to experiment with new technologies in order to accomplish our mission. description: Department Audio & Design Location Multiple Locations Product Fortnite Company Epic Games Requisition ID R24485 WHAT MAKES US EPIC? At the core of Epic’s success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it’s building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we’re always innovating. Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We’re constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development. UI DESIGN What We Do We design customer and user-focused experiences that are fresh and innovative, while problem solving by anticipating user behavior and hurdles. We approach the most complex of problems and address them with simple, intuitive, and useful solutions. What You'll Do Epic is looking for passionate Lead Technical UI Designers. In this position, you will lead and manage a team of Technical UI designers (4-8) working on a major initiative at Epic. You will guide your team to build well thought out features and systems using Unreal Engine, UMG, Blueprints, and C++. You will work collaboratively with a multidisciplinary team to ship features to millions of players around the world. In this role, you will Lead a team of Tech UI designers working in one of the major initiatives at Epic; work collaboratively across multiple teams to create consistency. Set up a culture of mentorship and excellence within the Tech UI design craft. Collaborate with other UX/UI Craft leads to ensure great communication is happening and stronger cross team relationships are built. Establish best practices and procedures for Tech UI Design. Help build tools and systems that will help clear up UI tech debt, make it easier and faster to ship UI, and level up the UI overall. What we're looking for A service oriented, compassionate leader. Experience managing a team of 2-8 people or equivalent training. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and experience presenting to other team members and stakeholders. Professional engine experience (Custom engine, Unity, UE4, Lumberyard, Snowdrop, etc.), and have game industry 3D-package experience (3D Studio, Maya, etc.). Scripting experience, bonus points for C++ experience Experience hiring and managing multiple teams. You’re known for thinking at big picture views strategically and identifying and solving extremely complex problem spaces. If you have a portfolio/reel/website you'd like to share, please hyperlink it to your resume, or submit it as an attachment with your application. This role is open to multiple locations across North America and Europe (including CA and WA). Pay Transparency Information The expected annual base pay range(s) for this position are detailed below. Each base pay range is relevant only for individuals who are residents of or will be expected to work within the specified locale. Compensation varies based on a variety of factors, which include (but aren’t limited to) things such as skills and competencies, qualifications, knowledge, and experience. In addition to base pay, most employees are eligible to participate in Epic’s generous benefit plans and discretionary incentive programs (subject to the terms of those plans or programs). California Base Pay Range $138,353—$202,917 USD Washington Base Pay Range $138,353—$202,917 USD ABOUT US Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we’ve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic’s award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent. Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic! Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Note to Recruitment Agencies: Epic does not accept any unsolicited resumes or approaches from any unauthorized third party (including recruitment or placement agencies) (i.e., a third party with whom we do not have a negotiated and validly executed agreement). We will not pay any fees to any unauthorized third party.

description: Wachter's greatest asset is the people who work here. Join the Wachter family and chart your career path! Wachter is currently accepting applications for a UX / UI Developer in our Lenexa, KS office. As a UX / UI Designer at Wachter, you are responsible for designing user interfaces that are visually appealing, easy to use, and empower our users (Wachter’s employees and customers) to efficiently do their jobs. Most of your attention will be focused on TRUST, our internal project, and customer relationship management application. You will focus on creating a seamless and enjoyable user experience by understanding user and business needs and crafting user-centered design solutions. This crucial role will focus on maintaining and improving the current iteration of Wachter's digital products and reimagining them for the future. We seek self-motivated and reliable candidates, who can work independently and find solutions to complete the job. Long-term employment with competitive pay and exceptional benefits for qualified candidates. We value relationships and invest in our employees. Benefits Package: Company Paid! Medical, Dental, Prescription & Vision Benefits Life, AD&D, and LTD insurance Paid Vacation and Holidays Teladoc & TriaHealth Company-Matched 401(k) and IRA Retirement Savings. Hybrid work schedule: Required to work in the office on Tuesday and Wednesday, with the option to work from home the rest of the week. Qualifications: Degree, certification, or comparable experience in UX / UI design. Strong portfolio displaying a range of design projects and your ability to solve user-centered design problems. Proficiency in design software such as Figma or similar tools. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Attention to detail, willingness to learn, and a passion for solving problems and creating exceptional user experiences. Optional Skills: Understanding of front-end development technologies and their impact on design. Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Experience in mobile app design. Key Responsibilities: Conduct user research to intimately understand the target audience, their needs, behaviors, and pain points. Synthesize and leverage data to inform design decisions. Design visually appealing guidelines. Create responsive designs that work well on various screen sizes and devices. Plan and conduct usability testing sessions to evaluate the effectiveness of designs. Iterate and make improvements based on user feedback and testing results. Work closely with cross-functional teams; including business analysts, developers, software testers, and stakeholders to ensure business needs, technical guidelines, and design goals are achieved. Collaborate on design reviews and incorporate feedback from team members. Regularly improve skills and share knowledge with the team. $65,000 - $80,000 a year Based on experience and qualifications. About: Wachter is a family-owned company since 1930 and we see each employee as a critical piece of the Wachter Family. With over 900 licenses across the country, Wachter serves commercial and industrial clients with the right technologies needed to keep them successful. We design, install, and maintain the technologies that keep businesses operating efficiently. Our team of dedicated electricians, engineers, and technicians provides electrical, data, security, communications, and automation services to clients in numerous industries. Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn. We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

description: Overview: HR Acuity is seeking a UX/UI Designer to join our UX/UI team. This person will conceive, design, and develop the UX designs for multiple product offerings in the roadmap. You’ll absorb product and feature themes, analyze, prepare, and articulate your ideas and with compelling illustrations, frameworks and prototypes. You’ll work closely with the product and engineering team stakeholders in supporting the product roadmap. This role reports directly to the Lead UX Designer. As a UX/UI Designer in a fast-paced startup, you should be a self-starter, be able to deal with a level of ambiguity and offer creative solutions to many of the design challenges we face. Along with design skills, you should have proficiency with Figma. This role is a key component of the product strategy at HR Acuity® and whilst experience is important, the ideal candidate will also complement our team, culture and drive! Who we are and what is our mission? HR Acuity helps companies deal with issues consistently, equitably, and transparently with state-of-the-art case management software. Our mission is to make work better, more equitable and safer for organizations and their employees. We are dedicated to continually raising the bar for employee relations by providing the consistency, compliance, and capabilities organizations need to protect their reputation and build a better workplace. If you share that passion with us, keep reading! Why work here? We are a fast-paced, high-growth, and innovative company. This is an “All-in Zone.” Everyone from our woman-owned CEO and founder to each individual team member embraces our #All-in mindset. We expect everyone to be fully engaged and to bring their best selves to work every day. We are passionate about our mission and our culture, and we expect everyone to be a part of it. Fair-Culture Warning: We are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace. We value different perspectives and backgrounds and strive to create an environment where everyone feels respected and valued. We are committed to creating an environment where everyone can be their authentic selves. Click here to learn more about our values and benefits ! The Opportunity: Day in the life as a UX Designer A day in the life of this role involves diving into user feedback and analytics, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and translating ideas into wireframes and prototypes. Conducting user testing sessions and working closely with developers, end-users, product managers, this UX designer ensures seamless design implementation, contributing to an innovative and user-centric experience. Responsibiliti es: Deeply understand the needs of our customers, their ER professionals, their managers and their employees. Conduct user interviews, surveys, and usability studies to gather insights into user behaviors and preferences. Analyze qualitative and quantitative data to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities for improving user experiences. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including designers and developers, to integrate user research findings into the product development process. Plan and execute usability testing sessions through Useberry or a similar tool, providing actionable recommendations for enhancing product usability. Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in UX research and UI trends. Develop and design wireframes, mockups, and user flows. Develop and maintain user personas and journey maps to inform design decisions. Iterate on research methodologies and tools to continually improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the UX research process. Own and communicate UX patterns and guidelines that contribute to the brand experience. Communicate research findings to stakeholders through compelling reports, presentations, and workshops. Work with product management and engineering groups to develop new products and features. Present work to stakeholders for review. Keep up-to-date with competitor products and industry trends. You'll love this role if... You enjoy collaborating with others You have a curious mind and looking to drive the future of multiple solutions and our business by creating the vision and strategy You are looking for the opportunity to create innovative AI solutions. Qualifications: Minimum of 3 years of experience as a UX/UI Designer, ideally in a SaaS B2B platform environment. (HR Tech a plus) Proven experience in web and native apps and mobile first design approaches. Strong understanding of Design Systems. Strong understanding of UX Research tools and process. Demonstrable experience with UX design for complex workflows in B2B or B2C SaaS products. Knowledge of & experience with design software such as Figma. Experience leading design work in an agile and fast-moving environment. AI experience is a plus. Designing with accessibility compliance experience a plus. What you bring Ability to balance short-term fixes and long-term roadmap. Excellent communication and data presentation skills. Strong attention to detail. Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, dynamic work environment. Ability to think creatively and solve problems. Perks and Benefits: Compensation: The pay range for this position is expected to be between $80,000 and $120,000/year; however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized, non-discriminatory factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other incentive compensation opportunities in the form of discretionary annual bonus or commissions, and equity. Additionally, full-time employees are eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits program, including health and wellness benefits, 401(k) retirement plan, life and disability insurance coverages, and other benefits the Company may offer from time to time. Benefits: Stay healthy and happy with our comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans. You can also choose from FSA or HSA options to suit your needs. Save for your future with our 401K plan that matches your contributions. Enjoy paid leave for various life events, such as sickness, disability, or parenthood. Own a piece of the company with our #Allin Shares Program. Perks: Take a break from work with our unlimited PTO policy to refresh and recharge. Company paid holidays, birthday day off, closed 4th of July week and December holiday week, half day summer Fridays* and half day first Fridays*, and 8 hours of volunteer time. Own a piece of the company with our #Allin Shares Program. Earn extra cash by referring qualified candidates to join our team. Access professional and personal support through our employee assistance program. Work from anywhere with our remote work environment that fosters collaboration and creativity. * Join a fun and energetic team that values your suggestions and new ideas. Receive a competitive salary and meaningful opportunities for growth. Learning and Development Onboarding: Learn the basics of your role, the company culture, and the expectations from your manager and team. Get familiar with the tools, systems, and processes that you will use in your daily work. Receive feedback and guidance from your mentor and peers. Manager training: Develop the skills and competencies to lead, motivate, and empower your team. Learn how to communicate effectively, delegate tasks, set goals, provide feedback, and resolve conflicts. Enhance your emotional intelligence, coaching, and mentoring abilities. Leadership training: Grow your leadership potential and influence within the organization. Learn how to inspire and align others with the company vision, mission, and values. Strengthen your strategic thinking, decision making, and problem-solving skills. Expand your network and collaboration with other leaders across functions and levels. Industry training: Stay updated on the latest trends, best practices, and innovations in the Employee Relations industry. Gain insights from experts and thought leaders in the field. Apply your learning to improve your performance, quality, and efficiency. Based upon business needs

description: The Intersection of Calling & Career World Vision is now hiring for Senior Product Designer (UX/UI). 00 At a Glance Role: Senior Product Designer (UX/UI) Job Design: Exceptional Digital Product Design 70%; Design System Management 20%; Design Team Leadership 10% Required Experience: Bachelor’s degree in design, digital art, interaction design, product design, or a related field or 8 years of equivalent work experience. Additionally, this role requires a minimum of 6-8 years of experience in the digital creative field. Your experience must include a minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience as a key interaction/visual designer within a product design and UX/UI team. Proven expertise in the development and management of design systems, with specific experience in modern design software. Demonstrable experience with storytelling techniques to effectively communicate and promote design ideas. Familiarity with frameworks such as Design Thinking and Jobs to be Done (JTBD), and the ability to adapt to evolving workflow philosophies. Proficient in responsive/mobile design principles and best practices. Extensive knowledge of layout principles, typography, and design best practices for both web and mobile platforms. Expertise in a variety of digital design software and prototyping tools. Preferred Experience: Prefer agency experience (in-house or external). Knowledge of how CSS and HTML work as it relates to how things are built by developers and come to life. Motion design skills are a plus. Salary Range: $82,632.63 - $131,997.59. Applies to locations with a market similar to our U.S. HQ in the Greater Seattle area. A different range may apply based on your work location. The typical hiring range is $100,000 - $112,000. Together, we empower the most vulnerable children to overcome poverty and experience the fullness of life. We help children of all backgrounds, even in the most dangerous places, inspired by our Christian faith. 01 The Job At World Vision USA we invite people to positively impact the lives of the world's most vulnerable children through charitable giving. Our recipe includes love of all people, thriftiness, and targeting the root causes of poverty to bring about human transformation and fullness of life. With us every 60 seconds a family gets water, a hungry child is fed, and a family gets the tools to overcome poverty. As Senior Product Designer (UX/UI), your expertise will be brought to bear on work that is close to the heart of God (in the spirit of Matthew 25:34-40). Look no further to connect your passion to life-changing work with impact by crafting digital experiences that align with our Christian organization’s mission, values, and strategic vision. By weaving the art of storytelling and deep product design insight, you'll captivate and retain users, ultimately driving long-term donor loyalty. Imagine joining a team where your creativity and design skills are not just valued but celebrated. You'll be part of an organization that is deeply committed to its mission and eager to see your talents shine. If you're ready to be the driving force behind user-centered digital products and make a meaningful impact, seize this opportunity and pursue joining our team at World Vision. Your journey toward purpose-driven innovation awaits. Responsive Design: Deliver responsive designs (desktop, mobile, tablet) in collaboration with the Digital Experience Team. Design Frameworks: Employ current methodologies, including Design Thinking and Jobs to be Done, to deliver comprehensive design solutions. Design Systems Management: Develop, maintain, and evolve a comprehensive design system, ensuring consistency across all digital products. Collaborate with stakeholders, front-end developers, and other designers to ensure that the design system is up-to-date, relevant, and effectively meets the needs of users and the business. Drive the adoption and adherence of the design system guidelines, promoting a consistent and cohesive user experience across all touchpoints. Research: Stay updated on the latest industry UX/UI trends, competitor strategies, and emergent interactive technologies. Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders throughout the product development cycle to ensure a seamless and coherent user experience. Meetings: Participate in key internal meetings including client discovery meetings to understand business goals and objectives. description: Tempur Sealyis committed to improving the sleep of more people, every night, all around the world. As a leading designer, manufacturer, distributor, and retailer of bedding products worldwide, we know how crucial a good night of sleep is to overall health and wellness. Utilizing over a century of knowledge and industry-leading innovation, we deliver award-winning products that provide breakthrough sleep solutions to consumers in over 100 countries. Our highly recognized brands include Tempur-Pedic®, Sealy® and Stearns & Foster®. We hire people who have a passion for helping others find their best night's sleep. No matter what stage of your career, you can build your future at Tempur Sealy! OUR COMPANY OFFERS GREAT BENEFITS, INCLUDING: Generous Paid Time Off Competitive Medical, Dental & other wellness programs Disability and Life Company Paid Retirement Plan Options Generous Employee Purchase Discounts Pay Range: $63,000-$92,000 What You'll Do (Essential Duties and Responsibilities): Make a profound impact on the visual quality and user experience of our digital products, reaching millions of users globally. Collaborate closely with internal and external teams to optimize all digital platforms, enhancing customer experience, boosting shopping confidence, fortifying brand presence, and driving growth. Demonstrate passion for user experience and designing best-in-class interfaces that effectively serve the needs of the user and the business. Comprehend and design for multiple device types and contexts (desktop, tablet, mobile) and responsive designs for the web. Exhibit a clear understanding of distinct UX and UI strategies tailored for direct-to-consumer websites and applications. Work closely with product and marketing managers, as well as developers, throughout the organization. Contribute to the creation of user flows, wireframes, mock-ups, and final designs aligned with business objectives and brand strategy. Contribute to all aspects of mobile and web design from prototyping and initial concepts to final delivery. Articulate your designs and bring them to life for developers via user journeys, user flows, wireframes, mock-ups, prototypes, presentations and comprehensively annotated design specifications. Utilize UX research tools, data, personas, competitive analysis, and metrics to shape user experiences. Make data-driven decisions, adapting quickly as priorities evolve. Use data to drive decision making, combined with the ability to alter direction quickly if needed as priorities shift. Revise and iterate designs and documentation based on continued user testing and feedback. Spur innovative ideas through expert-level knowledge of competitive and complimentary mobile and multi-platform products Understand the needs of all stakeholders to create intuitive and efficient designs. Perform other duties as assigned. description: At Mr. Cooper Group, You Make the Dream Possible. Our purpose is simple: Keeping the dream of homeownership alive. As a Mr. Cooper Group team member, you play a big role in making that dream possible. Around here, we know our roles and work together, volunteer to make a difference, and challenge the status quo when needed. Everything we do is in the care and service of our teammates and our customers. Join us and make the dream of home ownership possible! Are you a UX/UI Designer, whose excited about creating solutions that meet customer needs while aligning with business priorities by bringing the brand to life in meaningful way? If so...your solutions will be promoting digital and mobile adoption—all in a manner that is easy to use, and as efficient and simple as possible for our customers. Check it out... As a Member of Our Team, You Will... Work collaboratively with other teams taking a project from conception, through analysis, prototyping and testing, visual design, and finally to implementation ensuring the customers' view remains the focus. Be responsible for a number of products that have great volumes of data, frequent changes and require summarization and categorization with drill downs and expansions. The complexity and depth of the data require creative and innovative interactions for the users to understanding what they are viewing, analyzing and impacting. This multidiscipline position requires a systems-savvy person that is equal parts: experience architect and visual designer. Follow a customer-centered design process, understanding real customers—their goals, aptitudes, experiences, needs, motivations, and context. In this role you will approach design in a manner that finds the harmony between customer needs and desires, business goals and objectives, and technical capabilities. Work closely with product managers, their teams and software developers to determine necessary features and drive the design of products. Play a key role in translating industry experts’ insights and customer needs into great design that addresses requirements and creates elegant solutions. We Have Core Job Duties & Responsibilities... Design and deliver compelling, end-to-end customer experience solutions for multiple products and platforms, from assessing and defining customer needs to delivering concepts, to defining and elevating features, to presenting and evaluating prototypes, to addressing customer feedback. Create UI designs for responsive web and native mobile experiences, ensuring that design meets acceptable standards for quality and continuity with other Mr. Cooper products and digital touch points Leverage site maps, navigation maps, page flows, and other design artifacts to create sketches, conceptual designs, storyboards, usage scenarios, and prototypes. Work with developers and software engineers, project managers and QA—engaging throughout design/build process to ensure highest possible outcomes for products. Support customer insights initiatives, including focus groups, design validation, usability testing and ethnographic/observational research. The Desired Skills You Bring... Significant digital and mobile visual design experience Strong visual design skills with an interesting portfolio of work Experience creating storyboards, concepting and improving user process flows, as well as other design artifacts. Proficiency in Sketch is critical. Experience with Zeplin, Photoshop, Illustrator, Invision, After Effects, or other visual design tools helpful Proficiency in Figma is a plus Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user experience interaction across touch points and systems Ability to present your designs and solutions to various stakeholders in a compelling way Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies BFA/BS/MS in Graphic Design, Human Centered Design, Interaction Design, or related field of study preferred Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for rapid prototyping is a plus Mr. Cooper Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or status as a protected veteran. description: Remote Work Type: Fixed Term Contract About the Company Change the future of dementia care with Tembo Health. We’re aiming to make managing dementia and senior health easier through tailored services and innovative technology. Many PCPs don’t feel positioned to provide dementia care and families are left not knowing where to turn or feel unsupported. Making matters worse, dementia families can see medical costs, hospitalizations, and ER visits increase exponentially over time. With our innovative dementia care management solution, we empower patients, caregivers, primary care physicians, and health plans to navigate the complexities and burden of dementia care. Together, let's create a brighter and easier future for senior care. We're venture backed, with funding from big tech investors like Bloomberg Beta, B Capital, Resolute, AARP and led by a cadre of entrepreneurs who have built and scaled unicorn tech companies (e.g., Flatiron, Oscar, Imagen). Our team includes startup veterans, physicians, and more. We're here to make a big, meaningful impact on healthcare and have fun while we're at it. We're looking for smart, mission-driven, goal-oriented team members who are creative problem solvers and big dreamers. If that sounds like you, let's talk! Our Values and Culture At Tembo, we're on a big mission: improve health outcomes for seniors. To make this mission a reality, we value several things in how we work: Patients First. We're here to make the lives of patients better and every activity has this in mind. Great Ideas. It doesn't matter whose idea it is, if it's a great idea, let's do it! Get Stuff Done. Ideas are nothing without implementation. So go ahead and try things, break stuff, learn and improve. In line with our values, we look for people who are Customer-Focused. You are able to identify and work towards what customers want and need. You see customer satisfaction as tantamount to success. Smart and Curious / Solution Oriented. You're constantly learning and applying your knowledge to find innovative solutions. You love sharing your ideas and workshopping ideas to get to great answers. You're excited by the prospect of iterating on products and processes to make them better over time. Efficient & Effective / Good at Time Management. You know what it takes to accomplish your goal and aren't afraid to put in the work. More importantly, you know how to ruthlessly prioritize and focus on the important activities. Our team features a wide breadth of experience in various industries and functions. This means we're bringing different ideas to the table that yield lively discussions and creative solutions that couldn't happen with industry experts alone. About the Role We are seeking a highly creative and detail-oriented UI/UX Designer to join our dynamic team on a contract basis. This role requires a unique blend of passion for user-centered design, a deep understanding of user experience, and a keen eye for detail. The ideal candidate will be an innovative thinker who actively seeks to understand customer needs and enjoys iterating their designs through user feedback. This is a part-time, contract role for about 3 months with opportunities to extend. Key Responsibilities: Lead design for native app and adaptive web features across mobile, desktop, and tablet to ensure an optimal user experience. Create iterative design documentation including user journey flows, wireframes, visual designs, prototypes, and detailed specifications of behaviors and design implementation. Conduct user research (from usability studies, surveys, interviews, etc.) and usability testing to gather feedback, generate usage metrics, understand user needs, and inform design choices. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product management, and marketing, to create seamless and effective designs. Consider technical constraints and opportunities, working closely with engineers to guide designs from concept to implementation. Help implement and maintain Tembo Health’s design system Take full ownership of projects, from concept through to execution, ensuring high-quality outcomes. Stay abreast of UI/UX trends and best practices, applying them to improve our products and processes. Travel Requirements: We expect this role to potentially have up to 10% of travel for team meetings as well as user research and stakeholder engagement with our community customers and partners. About You Requirements: You’ll be a fit for this role if you have: 3+ years of proven experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role. A portfolio that demonstrates a human-centered design approach and problem-solving skills. Proficiency in design software (e.g., Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, etc.). Experience with user research and usability testing. Strong collaboration skills and experience working with cross-functional teams. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Bonus qualifications: Experience with designing with accessibility and seniors in mind Experience in healthcare UX/UI design
